reviews.review_text:
10/10 for ambiance and for mocktails they have. Clean washrooms.

Issue is with parking I guess. Not enough and dedicated space to parking.
Also they are selling packaged drinking water bottle at 50rs. I mean it‚Äôs  ridiculous.

Highly recommended starter dish - prawns fry with green stuffing. Food was really great.üëç

Ambience 5/5
A lovely environment with very beautiful antique decor showcasing the Goan culture.

Service 2/5
The service is very very very slow, even though there was no much crowd.
We had to wait for more than 1.5hrs for our order.
In the end we had to cancel one of our order due to delay.

Food  3/5
- Bharlele shinanyo and bharleli sungta were good
- But the thali (Chonak & Kingfish) was disappointing

Parking
- Only 3-4 cars can be parked in front of the restaurant.
- Otherwise there is no parking available, vehicle needs to be parked on the road

Our pursuit of an exceptional fish thali experience in Goa led us to discover a charming establishment in Nerul, conveniently located near Panjim. We were delighted to stumble upon this hidden gem, situated on the main road, showcasing stunning architecture that pays homage to Portuguese culture. This restaurant, housed in a converted heritage home, specializes in authentic Saraswat-style Goan cuisine, which left us thoroughly impressed. We opted for their signature fish thali, comprising rice, curry, two bhajis, sol Kadi, pickle, salad, kismoor, papad, sweet dish, three large rava fried prawns, and fish filet. Additionally, we tried the stuffed muscle, which was equally delectable. The restaurant's beautifully designed ambiance exudes a relaxed Goan vibe, making it a must-visit destination when in Nerul.
